topic.title: Abstract

body.p: The ODUk Central Packet Buffer (OCPB) contains a channelized packet switch (SCPB), and storage. The SCPB contains seven sets of logical FIFOs (port pairs). Push ports write data into per-channel FIFOs that are read by the pop port. Memory for the FIFOs is contained within the storage block (PMPM).
The OCPB only handles Constant Bit Rate (CBR) traffic. Channels arrive at the push ports as 128 byte bus words which are then passed to the pop ports as 128 byte artificial packets.
Channels on a given push port may broadcast to the other pop ports.
